data.title: Oracle Q4FY24 Earnings Customer Highlights
data.meta_description: Learn more about the Oracle customers that were highlighted in our latest quarterly earnings call.
data.text:
Customer highlights from Q4 FY24 earnings

Thank you, Bimbo Group, DNAnexus, Huntsville Hospital Health System, In-N-Out Burger, Palantir, Société Générale, and many others across many industries, for trusting us to help drive your business success. Learn more about these and other customers below.

Headquartered in Chelmsford, Massachusetts, Avesha provides AI and automation capabilities for companies to optimize their cloud applications’ performance. To improve performance and reduce costs, the company sought a new infrastructure provider and chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With OCI, Avesha expects to improve performance by 25%.

An Emmy Award–winning company, Beamr provides GPU-accelerated solutions for encoding, compressing, and optimizing images and video. Traditionally offering its technology as an SDK to media companies such as Netflix , Beamr chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to give customers a scalable, no-code implementation of its offering and has further plans to explore data optimization on LLMs and AI workloads.

Founded in 2016, Daily provides APIs that allow developers to integrate real-time audio, video, and AI features into their applications. Low latency is a top priority for the company, as developers trust Daily for routing media and inference packets to any device or network across the globe. Daily chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure due to its broad global footprint, interconnection capabilities, compute flexibility, and strong engineering support.

Founded in 2009, DNAnexus is a leading enterprise bio-informatics platform powering a global network for scientific collaboration and discovery. To better optimize its AI pipelines, the company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With OCI's processing power and scalability, DNAnexus can deliver faster genomic analysis and AI models while increasing its platform's availability to OCI, Oracle Health, and Oracle Database customers.

Go2future combines computer vision and artificial intelligence to provide retailers with secure automation, real-time customer analysis, and checkout optimization tools. The company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to power its AI inference process. With OCI, Go2future is set to scale its autonomous store concept across further locations throughout Latin America.

Based in Curitiba, Brazil, MeetRox provides generative AI services to sales teams, offering a solution that records and transcribes sales calls, automatically populates CRM data, and evaluates the quality of sales pitches at scale. To power its speech-to-text capabilities, the company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. By leveraging OCI's GPU power, MeetRox can automatically generate insights that enable sellers to focus more on their customers and sell more.

MetaVoice is building conversational voice agents for customer service via a multimodal large language model that works across speech and text. MetaVoice chose Oracle for its cloud-AI infrastructure and large enterprise user base, leveraging NVIDIA GPU clusters on OCI to train its proprietary machine learning models.

Modal Labs helps data, AI, and machine learning teams develop generative AI and inference models at scale. It also offers services that allow customers to fine-tune LLMs, run protein folding simulations, and more at a rapid speed. The company leverages GPUs on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to serve its customers with the best price, performance, scale, and support.

Numenta has built a scalable, secure, and cost-effective LLM inference solution for enterprises. Built on decades of neuroscience research, the Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing is optimized for running LLMs on CPU-based architectures, enabling it to handle multiple asynchronous models with no need for batching. Numenta has selected Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to power its model training due to Oracle's scalable GPU infrastructure and superior networking performance.

A subsidiary of Exela Group, Reaktr.ai epitomizes Exela and XBP Europe’s visionary foray into the realm of artificial intelligence, offering cybersecurity, multicloud management, data modernization, and AI solutions to global enterprises. To optimize performance and reduce costs, the company strategically elected to migrate a selection of on-premises and existing cloud applications to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. This migration has served as a pivotal foundation for Reaktr’s continued growth across healthcare, finance, telecommunications, government, and other sectors.

Headquartered in Las Vegas, Nevada, Remark Holdings is an industry leader in AI-powered analytics, computer vision, and smart agent solutions, delivering an integrated suite of AI tools that help organizations understand their customer demographics and behavior while monitoring, understanding, and acting on potential security threats in real time. Remark chose to migrate to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, leveraging its global footprint and scalability to support the company’s growing performance needs for training and inference services both domestically and internationally, as Oracle is rapidly expanding its services in the same geographies.

Suno AI is a leading AI audio and song development platform, offering top-tier models that are capable of transforming text into realistic speech, music, and sound effects. The company is using GPUs on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to release its Chirp v4 model to create a more personal and enhanced experience for users.

Upstage is a fast-growing enterprise AI startup with flagship products including Document AI and Solar LLM. Enterprises use Upstage’s products to transform their documents into machine-readable data and create purpose-trained LLMs for their business. Upstage chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with NVIDIA GPUs to effectively scale to meet its data needs, resulting in a 50% improvement in model training time and accelerated go-to-market times for its customers in Asia and the US.

Headquartered in Porto Alegre, Brazil, Wide Labs is an AI company blending health sciences, computer sciences, and communications expertise to develop innovative solutions. Its multidisciplinary team develops award-winning technology, such as the bAIgrapher platform for Alzheimer's treatment. Wide Labs is using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure as part of its efforts in areas such as conversational AI, deep learning, and health prediction, aiming to make a real impact on individuals and businesses.

Founded in 1987 in Boxtel, the Netherlands, ABS Laundry Business Solutions is a leader in ERP solutions for the textile industry. To support its global operations, ABS required a platform that offered worldwide hosting, high availability, and efficient batch processing. After careful evaluation, ABS selected Oracle Cloud Infrastructure for its cost-effectiveness, high performance, scalability, and ability to meet stringent uptime and monitoring requirements.

ALEXBANK, one of Egypt’s leading private sector banks, chose Oracle Cloud services to optimize infrastructure scalability and enhance overall operational efficiency through faster patching cycles and additional security features. With Oracle, ALEXBANK will also leverage automated scaling to accommodate sudden growth periods, delivering a better customer experience while significantly reducing costs.

Abdul Latif Jameel United Finance Company is a closed joint-stock company licensed by the Saudi Central Bank, providing financing to individuals and businesses across Saudi Arabia. The organization sought a cloud provider and chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to support its ambitious growth plans and drive innovation.

With teams in four different countries, Apica provides tools and automation for data management, security, and monitoring. To better support resource needs, scalability, and cost efficiency, Apica chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to power its FLOW platform for data pipeline control. With OCI, FLOW can serve customers and fulfill the company’s data pipeline needs more effectively via a more scalable architecture, modular infrastructure, and greater compute power and storage capacity.

Operating in more than 30 countries, Arcadis NV delivers sustainable design, engineering, and consultancy solutions for natural and built assets. Seeking a way to provide better global business insights, Arcadis chose a suite of Oracle products, including Oracle Exadata, Oracle Analytics Cloud, and Oracle Database. With Oracle’s centralized and scalable solutions, Arcadis expects to achieve greater efficiency and usability while enabling shared service centers.

Banco Credito Social Cooperativo is the head entity of the premier cooperative banking group in Spain (Grupo Cajamar, established in 1963). Aiming to enhance cost efficiency and scalability, the bank sought a new strategy to modernize its existing Oracle Database platform. The company chose Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer, Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, and Oracle Exadata Database Service to improve database availability and service levels, help ensure compliance, and boost performance, all while securing support for mission-critical workloads and multicloud strategies.

Based in Vienna, Austria, the holding company BAWAG Group AG provides financial services to more than 2.1 million retail, small business, corporate, real estate, and public sector customers. Needing to bring its entire Oracle stack to the cloud, the company chose Oracle Database Exadata Cloud Service on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With Oracle, BAWAG improved system performance, increased efficiency, and optimized both availability and scalability.

Founded in Lisbon in 1876, Caixa Geral de Depósitos (CGD) is one of the leading banks in Portugal. The bank needed a reliable disaster recovery solution that complied with regulatory requirements and chose Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer with Oracle Autonomous Database and Oracle Data Safe. With Oracle, CGD has reduced costs, improved database performance, and integrated stronger data protection.

Circles is a global technology company headquartered in Singapore that offers a full-stack software solution for the telecommunications industry. The company recently chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to power its core product development environment and has further plans to leverage OCI as it rapidly scales globally with leading telco customers.

Operating more than 40,000 vehicles across 12 countries, ComfortDelGro is a leading multimodal transport operator headquartered in Singapore. By moving on-premises Oracle Databases for its Singapore taxi business to Oracle Autonomous Database running on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, the company reduced its database-related costs significantly over three years while meeting its data residency and security requirements.

Based out of Phoenix, Arizona, Crexendo provides enterprise cloud communication platforms and services to help organizations support collaboration and remote work. The company sought to migrate its NetSapiens software to the cloud and chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with support from Oracle Cloud Lift Services. With Oracle, Crexendo expects significantly shorter onboarding time frames, reduced network latency, and stronger security for customers.

GeneDx is a pioneering force in medical genetics, offering industry-leading exome and genome testing fueled by one of the world’s largest rare disease data sets. To optimize its cloud infrastructure and improve costs, the company chose to migrate its core platforms to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, driving significant cost savings.

Founded in 2007, Glassnote Records is a leading independent record label and home to Grammy Award–winning and multiplatinum-selling artists, including Mumford & Sons, Phoenix, and Childish Gambino. The company sought a cloud solution to manage key data across disparate systems, including social media data, artist metadata, distribution data, and financial data. Glassnote chose Oracle and used Oracle Autonomous Database, Oracle Analytics, and Oracle Integration Cloud to consolidate data, expedite report generation to inform resource allocation, and optimize marketing processes.

GlobeMed provides healthcare benefits management and international health services, supporting more than 23 million people across the Middle East and North Africa. The company chose to gradually migrate its on-premises workloads to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Using OCI Secure Desktops, GlobeMed created integrations with existing apps, reduced costs, and improved the security of sensitive data.

Based out of Mexico City, Grupo Fanafesa is Mexico’s largest distributor of pharmaceuticals and medical supplies. The company chose Oracle Cloud Applications on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with fully managed services from Oracle Customer Success Services. With Oracle, Grupo Fanafesa has met performance goals while reducing IT costs through dynamic scaling and storage optimization.

Italo is the first private operator on the Italian high-speed railway network. The company wanted a cloud provider to optimize efficiency and costs related to database infrastructures and existing Oracle applications. Italo chose Oracle Database Exadata Cloud Service to enhance data performance and security while using the latest cloud capabilities.

Since launching in early 2023, Jagat has become one of the fastest growing location-based social media applications, with more than 10 million users. To reduce total cost of ownership, the company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure as its data platform. With OCI, Jagat optimizes costs while meeting necessary compliance and security requirements.

Headquartered in Zaragoza, Spain, Master Distancia provides courses to more than 50,000 learners annually in Spain and Portugal. Seeking to move IT costs from capital expenses to operating expenses as the business grew, the company chose to migrate to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With OCI, Master Distancia optimized the total cost of ownership, increased IT infrastructure agility, and minimized downtime.

Saudi Arabia’s Ministry of Municipal and Rural Affairs and Housing (MOMRAH) has pioneered the region’s Quality of Life project to combat visual pollution affecting aesthetic appeal. To support this initiative, MOMRAH chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure as its data platform, enabling the organization to accelerate the detection of visual pollutants to improve local aesthetics, all while operating on a cost-effective and secure platform.

Founded in 1994, Monster Worldwide is a global provider of recruitment solutions, most notably operating the job platform Monster.com. The company sought to replace existing hardware supporting its Oracle E-Business Suite service in a local data center and chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure with support from Oracle Customer Success Services. Monster will now run Oracle E-Business Suite on OCI, projecting 35% annual savings and 25% better performance.

As Norway’s largest grocery wholesaler, NorgesGruppen has more than 1,800 affiliated grocery stores in 88% of Norway’s municipalities. The company chose Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer to migrate its database platform to the cloud while maintaining security standards and scaling on demand, enabling it to offer a more stable distribution channel and better customer experiences.

Founded in 1947, Norsk Tipping is a government-owned gambling company administered by the Norwegian Ministry of Culture. Needing a cloud platform capable of running in parallel with its database systems, the company chose Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer for its scalability, simplified management, and lower cost. With Oracle, Norsk Tipping expects to enhance its systems with better reliability, faster loading times, and an improved user experience.

Headquartered in Doha, Qatar, Ooredoo Qatar provides mobile, wireless, and content services across international telecommunications markets. To address data residency and performance constraints in its data center, the company chose Oracle Exadata Cloud@Customer to replace all non-Oracle infrastructure. With Oracle, Ooredoo Qatar optimized cost and improved performance while consolidating databases in a database-as-a-service solution.

Oro Inc. is the independent software vendor behind OroCommerce, a digital commerce platform designed to meet the unique needs of B2B sellers. To support its efforts to evolve its product offerings and expand into new markets, the company chose to replace its current cloud infrastructure provider with Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With the move, the company expects to save up to 30% on cloud infrastructure costs while also benefiting from improved application performance.

Based in Tampa, Florida, communications technology innovator Syniverse is the world’s most connected company. A longtime Oracle customer, the company embarked on an effort to upgrade a large on-premises database estate, choosing Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With OCI, Syniverse is smoothly migrating to the cloud and exploring further opportunities, including customer integrations.

The Secretaria de Estado da Fazenda de Santa Catarina (SEF/SC) is responsible for the management, accounting, and control of public funds for the state of Santa Catarina in Brazil. The organization chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure for more reliable and secure technology. After migrating to OCI, SEF/SC achieved significant gains in performance and governance, resulting in a significant increase in tax revenue.

Stellar Cyber helps security operations teams reduce risk while improving efficiency. The company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to host its flagship software as a service, OpenXDR. With OCI, Stellar Cyber improved compute, storage, and network performance at a worldwide scale while reducing costs. The company is deeply integrated with OCI’s native security to deliver instant AI-led threat detection for OCI customers.

Founded in Dubai, Ziwo is a leading contact-center-as-a-service provider for emerging countries. Needing to safeguard communications while adhering to local regulations, the company chose Oracle Cloud Infrastructure to support its data needs. OCI provides Ziwo with improved availability, greater reliability, and stronger data protection while integrating with more than 15 CRM systems.

Access World is an end-to-end logistics service provider with a network of port and warehouse facilities spread across more than 30 countries. The company chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, SCM, and HCM to unify its financial and operational systems and provide a centralized platform for employee learning, training, and talent management.

As Türkiye’s largest healthcare provider, Acibadem operates a chain of hospitals and outpatient clinics employing more than 20,000 people. The organization chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, SCM, and Procurement to streamline and speed up financial reporting and purchasing. With Oracle, Acibadem can automate and connect its business processes, giving it a clear picture of costs and savings and helping it build a resilient supply chain.

With a portfolio of more than 11,000 stores across nearly 60 malls, ALLOS is Brazil’s largest shopping mall administrator. To improve the performance of its financial and accounting applications, ALLOS migrated to Oracle Cloud Applications with jointly managed services from Oracle Customer Success Services. With Oracle, ALLOS improved financial transaction speed and environment reliability while minimizing risks through automation and monitoring.

Americold Realty Trust is a US-based real estate investment trust focused on owning, operating, and developing temperature-controlled warehouses. Since 2011, Americold had used SAP financial, plant maintenance, and analysis tools in North America, but the company wanted alternatives to help it scale as it’s grown into a global business. After comprehensive evaluations of Oracle, SAP, and Workday, Americold decided to move to Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, EPM, and HCM.

Founded in 1882, Austin Health is one of Australia’s leading hospital systems, with prestigious teaching, training, and research centers. The organization’s legacy ERP system was coming to end of life, so Austin Health chose to implement Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP to meet its current and future needs.

Capri Global Capital is a non-banking financial company offering diversified financial services such as lending across multiple products, including MSME loans, housing loans, gold loans, construction finance, and indirect lending. The company recently embarked on its Capri 2.0 journey and was looking for a robust and scalable ERP system. CGCL chose to migrate to Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP and EPM to support its aspiration to deliver next-generation solutions.

DocuSign offers intelligent agreement management solutions that accelerate the process of doing business and help more than 1.5 million customers throughout the world to unleash the value of data within their agreements. DocuSign recently went live with Oracle Retail’s Automated Clearing House payments capabilities, building on its implementation of Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP.

Founded in 1945, Grupo Bimbo is one of Mexico’s largest food companies, with a presence in 35 countries and multinational brands such as Tia Rosa, Sara Lee, and Oroweat. The company sought to automate plants worldwide while generating real-time business insights and chose Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications to meet this goal. With Oracle, Grupo Bimbo has optimized operations, managed risks, and accelerated month-end closing while transitioning legacy systems.

INDEVCO specializes in the manufacture of corrugated cardboard, plastic and paper packaging, tissue, and various household and personal care disposables. The company chose a suite of Oracle Fusion Cloud Applications, including Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, EPM, and SCM, to build a single platform to manage finances, costs, and reporting across the designated INDEVCO Group affiliates, including Napco National, and help facilitate the integration of acquired companies.

The Indian Hotels Company Limited (IHCL), India’s largest hospitality company, brings together a group of brands and businesses that offer a fusion of warm Indian hospitality and world-class service. Its brands include Taj, SeleQtions, Vivanta, and Ginger. Founded in 1903, IHCL has a portfolio of 322 hotels, including 99 under development globally, across four continents, 13 countries, and more than 100 locations. An Oracle OPERA on-premises user, IHCL will optimize operations and enhance guest experiences by migrating to Oracle Hospitality OPERA Cloud, starting with 120 hotels across its portfolio.

Originating in Los Angeles, California, more than 75 years ago, In-N-Out Burger is an American fast-food chain known for its burgers, fries, and milkshakes. The company chose to add Oracle Fusion Cloud Transportation Management to its lineup of Oracle applications, which includes Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, HCM, and SCM. With Oracle Transportation Management, In-N-Out Burger can optimize its logistics network, track driver and carrier performance, gain deeper business insights through analytics, reduce manual operations, and ultimately ensure efficient delivery of its fresh ingredients.

A joint venture between Marks & Spencer Group and Ocado Group, Ocado Retail is a leading online supermarket and grocery retailer. The company recently transitioned from a shared instance of Oracle E-Business Suite Financials to Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP. Ocado Retail used Oracle Guided Learning and Oracle Cloud Learning Subscriptions during implementation to help employees adopt the new system more easily and allow for a smoother go-live experience.

Serving clients in the aerospace, nuclear, financial services, transportation, and logistics industries, Onet offers professional services such as security and alarm systems, cleaning crews, transportation, and facility management. The company chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP and EPM, Oracle Customer Experience, and Oracle Fusion Data Intelligence for a single technology platform that allows it to standardize business processes and boost overall performance, helping it concentrate on international expansion.

Pike Corporation and its family of companies is one of the largest providers of construction and engineering services for investor-owned, municipal, and cooperative electric utilities and telecommunications companies in the United States. The company was using fragmented systems that required manual effort, had limited data availability and visibility, and lacked the ability to efficiently capture, report on, and manage complex projects. Pike Corporation chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, HCM, EPM, SCM, and Procurement, along with Oracle Field Service, allowing it to tap real-time analytics powered by a common data model to drive growth.

Based in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, the Saudi Cement Company is a regional pioneer in the manufacture and supply of high-quality clinker and cement. With customers across the Arab Gulf states and internationally, the company wanted a comprehensive view of its business and chose a suite of Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, EPM, and SCM and Oracle CX applications for access to unified dashboards, intelligent reporting, and analytics-driven insights.

Operating for 160 years, Société Générale is a French global financial services provider with 117,000 employees. This past quarter, the company went live with Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM for core human resources, time and labor, and absence processes for 14,000 employees, with additional rollouts to follow.

Solistica is a comprehensive logistics operator offering 3PL solutions. With a strong presence in Brazil, Colombia, Mexico, and Latin America, the company provides security, innovation, and flexibility, serving more than 4,000 clients across the entire supply chain through storage solutions, FTL and LTL transportation and distribution, multimodal solutions, value-added services, vehicle maintenance, and international logistics services. Solistica has adopted Oracle Cloud solutions across its various operations, including using Oracle Fusion Cloud Enterprise Resource Planning in its LTL operation and running its entire 3PL operation on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. With this initiative, Solistica enhances the availability of its systems for all its 24/7 operations.

With a portfolio of iconic wagering and gaming products and services, Tabcorp is Australia’s largest gambling company. Needing to replace outdated on-premises applications and unify back-office operations and reporting, the company chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, HCM, and SCM. With Oracle, Tabcorp can reduce operational costs, simplify processes, and accelerate reporting through a common data model and optimized integrations.

The Vietnam Technological and Commercial Joint-Stock Bank, commonly referred to as Techcombank, is one of the largest joint-stock commercial banks in Vietnam and a leading financial institution in Asia. The bank chose Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, EPM, and Procurement to establish an integrated and automated general ledger, centralize its accounting rules, and improve its financial reporting, planning, and analysis.

With operations in the UK and Ireland, Telent is a British telecommunications, IT network, and digital infrastructure company with nearly 3,000 employees. With Oracle Guided Learning Premium and Oracle Customer Success Services, the company integrated Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM with Oracle Payroll. Using this new system, Telent saw 81.5% user engagement within seven days of the launch.

Unipart delivers supply chain solutions and performance improvement technologies worldwide. The company chose Oracle Fusion Cloud Transportation Management to support its global growth strategy. With support from Oracle Customer Success Services, Unipart has enhanced operational efficiencies and significantly reduced testing time for new software capabilities.

Yanbu Cement Company is one of the major cement manufacturers in Saudi Arabia. The company relies on Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, HCM, SCM, and EPM to improve efficiencies, automate processing cycles, support decision-making, and align its operations with smart manufacturing tools and processes.
